values:
"So, this is it" He says, as he opens the door.

I walk in past him, looking at the makeshift bedroom, which also doubles as the living room. "Nice," I say, as I sit on the couch.

"Can I get you anything to drink?"

"Sure," I get up and walk into the small kitchen.

"I don't have much..."he trails off as I wrap my arm around his waist. Kissing him on the cheek, I tell him that it's alright.

We walk back into the living room, his arm wrapped around me, and leads me to the couch. "So...what would you like to do?" I shrug as I reach for his guitar.

"Teach me" I answer simply.

Putting down his drink, he slides closer. Placing his hand on top of mine, he shows me how to hold it properly. As he shows me basic notes, I lean in and kiss him on his lips. "What was that for?" he asks in surprise.

"Nothing. Just felt like it." I smile and look back at the guitar. After about twenty minutes of attempted playing, I put the guitar down as he turns on the television.

It's not much, but it's a start. I'll finish it at a later time.
